name: Mont Blanc
hint: Highest peak in the Alps, on the French-Italian border

name: Matterhorn
hint: Iconic pyramid-shaped peak on the Swiss-Italian border

name: Mount Olympus
hint: Highest mountain in Greece, mythical home of the gods

name: Mount Elbrus
hint: Highest peak in Europe, a dormant volcano in the Caucasus Mountains of Russia

name: Ben Nevis
hint: Highest mountain in the British Isles, located in the Scottish Highlands

name: Grossglockner
hint: Highest mountain in Austria

name: Zugspitze
hint: Highest peak in Germany, on the Austrian border

name: Galdhopiggen
hint: Highest mountain in Norway and Scandinavia

name: Mount Etna
hint: Europe's tallest active volcano, on the island of Sicily

name: Mount Vesuvius
hint: Famous volcano near Naples that destroyed Pompeii in 79 AD

name: Dufourspitze
hint: Highest peak in Switzerland, part of the Monte Rosa massif near Zermatt

name: Mulhacen
hint: Highest peak on the Iberian Peninsula, in Spain's Sierra Nevada range

name: Eiger
hint: Famous Swiss peak with a fearsome north face, one of the great Alpine challenges

name: Jungfrau
hint: Swiss Alpine peak whose name means 'maiden', accessible by Europe's highest railway

name: Gran Paradiso
hint: Highest peak entirely within Italy, centerpiece of Italy's oldest national park

name: Teide
hint: Highest peak in Spain and the Atlantic islands, a volcano on Tenerife in the Canaries

name: Kebnekaise
hint: Highest mountain in Sweden, located above the Arctic Circle in Lapland

name: Rysy
hint: Highest peak in Poland, in the Tatra Mountains on the Slovak border

name: Triglav
hint: Highest peak in Slovenia, featured on the national flag and coat of arms

name: Musala
hint: Highest peak in Bulgaria and the entire Balkan Peninsula, in the Rila Mountains

name: Stromboli
hint: Continuously erupting Italian volcano island, called the Lighthouse of the Mediterranean

name: Hekla
hint: One of Iceland's most active volcanoes, once called the Gateway to Hell

name: Snowdon
hint: Highest peak in Wales, reachable by a scenic mountain railway

name: Carrauntoohil
hint: Highest peak in Ireland, in the Macgillycuddy's Reeks range of County Kerry

name: Gerlachovsky Stit
hint: Highest peak in Slovakia and the entire Carpathian Mountains
